title: Phrack Pro-Phile: Mudge
historical_context: Mudge is a prominent figure in the hacker community, known for his contributions to security research and the hacker culture of the late 90s.
target_audience: Hackers, security professionals, and those interested in hacker culture.
short_summary: This article features an in-depth profile of Mudge, a notable hacker known for his early work on buffer overflows and contributions to the hacker community. It highlights his personal interests, memorable experiences, and thoughts on the hacker scene.
summary:
In this Phrack Pro-Phile, Mudge, a well-known hacker and member of the L0pht, shares insights into his life, interests, and the hacker community. He reflects on his journey from cracking Apple software to becoming a respected figure in security research. Mudge emphasizes the importance of community and information sharing, noting that the dissemination of exploits often prompts companies to address their software vulnerabilities. His experiences range from technical achievements, such as writing buffer overflows, to personal anecdotes that illustrate the camaraderie within the hacker scene.

Mudge's profile also touches on his views about the distinction between hackers and computer geeks, asserting that true hackers possess a creative twist that allows them to manipulate technology beyond its intended use. He expresses gratitude for the support of his peers and the opportunities that have shaped his career. Overall, this article serves as a testament to Mudge's impact on the hacking community and his belief in the continuous pursuit of knowledge and innovation.
